SEARCH
Package com.fane.Front_End

Class SceneController

java.lang.Object
com.fane.Front_End.SceneController
public class SceneController extends Object
The SceneController class manages the interaction between the graphical user interface (GUI) components and the underlying logic of the Text Editor application. It handles various actions triggered by user interactions and updates the state of the application accordingly. This class is part of the Front_End package and serves as the controller for the GUI scenes.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Mohamed AL AFTAN Djakaridja FANE

  • Method Details

    • switchToEditFile

      public void switchToEditFile(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the "Edit File" scene. Loads the "/fxml/Graphic.fxml" file and sets it as the new scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggered the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during loading the new scene.

    • switchToMainMenu

      public void switchToMainMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the "Main Menu" scene. Loads the "/fxml/Main_Menu.fxml" file and sets it as the new scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggered the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during loading the new scene.

    • switchToCredits

      public void switchToCredits(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Switches the current scene to the "Credits" scene. Loads the "/fxml/Credits.fxml" file and sets it as the new scene.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent that triggered the method.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during loading the new scene.

    • updateTextField

      public void updateTextField(String text)
      Updates the content of the associated TextArea with the provided text.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to set in the TextArea.

    • SelectAction

      public String[] SelectAction(String messageDialog1, String messageDialog2, String messageError)
      Displays input dialogs to obtain two numerical values from the user, ensuring the validity of the inputs.
      Parameters:
      messageDialog1 - The prompt for the first value.
      messageDialog2 - The prompt for the second value.
      messageError - The error message displayed if the inputs are invalid.
      Returns:
      An array containing the validated numerical input values.

    • InsertAction

      public void InsertAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Executes the insert action, prompting the user for input and updating the editor accordingly. The method adds the insert command to the invoker, obtains the start and end indices for insertion, and the text to insert from the user through input dialogs. It then executes the insert command on the invoker and updates the editor's state.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the insert action.

    • CopyAction

      public void CopyAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Executes the copy action, prompting the user for input and updating the editor accordingly. The method adds the copy command to the invoker, obtains the start and end indices for copying, and then executes the changeSelection and copy commands on the invoker. It displays information about the copy operation and updates the editor's state.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the copy action.

    • PasteAction

      public void PasteAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Executes the paste action, prompting the user for input and updating the editor accordingly. The method adds the paste command to the invoker, obtains the start and end indices for pasting, and then executes the changeSelection and paste commands on the invoker. It displays information about the paste operation and updates the editor's state.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the paste action.

    • CutAction

      public void CutAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Executes the cut action, prompting the user for input and updating the editor accordingly. The method adds the cut command to the invoker, obtains the start and end indices for cutting, and then executes the changeSelection and cut commands on the invoker. It displays information about the cut operation and updates the editor's state.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the cut action.

    • DeleteAction

      public void DeleteAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Executes the delete action, prompting the user for input and updating the editor accordingly. The method adds the delete command to the invoker, obtains the start and end indices for deleting, and then executes the changeSelection and delete commands on the invoker. It displays information about the delete operation and updates the editor's state.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the delete action.

    • StartAction

      public void StartAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Initiates the recording of user actions in the editor. The method adds the start command to the invoker and executes it. It displays a confirmation popup indicating that the editor has started recording user actions.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the start action.

    • StopAction

      public void StopAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Stops the recording of user actions in the editor. The method adds the stop command to the invoker and executes it. It displays a confirmation popup indicating that the editor has stopped recording user actions.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the stop action.

    • ReplayAction

      public void ReplayAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Replays the recorded actions saved in the editor. The method adds the replay command to the invoker and executes it. It displays a confirmation popup indicating that the saved actions are being replayed. Additionally, it updates the editor's text field with the current buffer contents after replaying.
      Parameters:
      event - The ActionEvent triggering the replay action.
